intro: Stenanthemum pumilum subsp. majus, commonly known as the large-flowered stenanthemum, is a small shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the spring and summer months. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in native garden landscapes.
